title: What is the most powerful political dynasty in American history? - Quora
tags: Political History of the United States of America
History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: I would say either the Bushs or the Kennedys.   The Bush family had Prescott Bush as a Senator, then Herbert Walker as CIA director, US Ambassador to the UN, Congressman, Vice president and then president, Jeb Bush as the governor of Florida, George W. Bush as governor of Texas and president, and George P. Bush running for office in Texas. The Kennedys were a glamorous dynasty.  Patrick Joseph Kennedy was a congressman from Massachusetts.  His son Joseph Patrick Kennedy Sr. was an advisor to FDR and held multiple positions including US Ambassador to Britain, Chairman of the Maritime Commission, Chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission.  Joseph P. Kennedy Sr.'s oldest son, Joseph P. Kennedy Jr. , wanted to be president until his tragic death, John Fitzgerald Kennedy overcame incumbents to serve in both Congressional houses for Massachusetts before skyrocketing to the Presidency.  Tragically he was assassinated while in office.  Skip forward several years, Bobby Kennedy, the third son, became U.S. Attorney General, a Senator, and then ran for president.  He was shot while on the campaign trail.  The fourth Kennedy boy, Ted Kennedy was also a Senator.  His son, Patrick J. Kennedy II, was a congressman also.  JFK's daughter is still serving as the US Ambassador to Japan. Both of these families have powerful and important political dynasties.  They have fielded multiple presidents/presidential candidates and have had multiple impacts on America's political history.

Here’s purely subjective list welcoming criticism:(10) Adams of Massachusetts, (9) Bush of Connecticut/Texas/FL, (8) Taft of Ohio, (7) Sulzberger/Ochs of New York , (6) Kennedy of Massachusetts/NY/RI, (5) Genovese of New York, (4) Roosevelt of New York, (3) Ford of Michigan, (2) DuPont of Delaware, (1) Rockefeller of New York, WV, Ark  The Rockefeller brothers: (l-r)David, Winthrop, John III Nelson, Laurence  1950 reunion of the DuPont family  Henry Ford family tree  Franklin D Roosevelt and family. This doesn’t include his (and his wife Eleanor’s) Theodore Roosevelt cousins.  Vito Genovese, Crime Boss  The Kennedys  Sulzberger-Ochs family tree  President William Howard Taft and family. 1911

Skull and Bones Skull and Bones is a fraternity out of Yale, and George W Bush, George HW Bush, and William Howard Taft all hail from there. Along with them is the “father of modern football”, the founder of FedEx Fredrick Wallace Smith, William Buckley Jr., multiple senators, the lead on the Hubble project, and multiple billionaires. Their reputation is associated with “the power elite”. Here is a great quote from Lanny Davis describing the secret society: “If the society had a good year, this is what the "ideal" group will consist of: a football captain; a Chairman of the Yale Daily News; a conspicuous radical; a Whiffenpoof; a swimming captain; a notorious drunk with a 94 average; a film-maker; a political columnist; a religious group leader; a Chairman of the Lit; a foreigner; a ladies' man with two motorcycles; an ex-service man; a negro, if there are enough to go around; a guy nobody else in the group had heard of, ever” And according to my professor - “If you want to be part of the American elite - join Skull and Bones” Hope this helped!

Probably not possible to answer definitively because "most powerful" is so nebulous. The Adams and Bush family each had two POTUS who were father/son, with the Bushes also having a governor. But one could argue that the Kennedys were more powerful overall because they lasted longer, from Joseph (power behind the scenes) to today.
